critique: This document primarily amends a previous executive order to include the Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998. It focuses on the internal management of the Federal Government and international development/conservation efforts. There's no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration policy, or impacts on national security vs. civil liberties. It seems to expand executive power slightly by modifying the board's composition and responsibilities. It also appears to favor federal control through the management of international agreements. There's a slight lean towards intervention through conservation efforts and a neutral stance on social inclusion.
